description.label: As your website loads, it shows all the api request your website calls, this tool is very powerfull for checking whats taking more time in your request, where can you improve, are ther too many requests or they are big....
It shows all the details of individaul requests like name, time it took, size of reponse, initiator, status and all...
When ever you hit a website, the first thing you get back is the index.html, then browser parses that document and starts calling to other resources like images, links, css
Lets take an example of upgrad.com
Browser itself prioritize resources like images it de priortize images over css.
Shift while hover: it highlight your initiator
Lets look at the color codes for the index.html for upgrad.com and analyse some the request.
The request was posponed by rendering engine because it considered lower priority than critical resources (such as scripts/styles), this often happens with the images.
The request was put on hold because browser only allows six TCP connections per origin on HTTP 1.
Thats why you bundle your resources like css and js or sprites for images, is to avoid this queing.
Time the request spent waiting before it could sent. It can be waiting for any of the reasons described for queing.
Time spent performing the DNS lookup.
Every new domain on a page requires a full roundtrip to do the DNS lookup.
Time it took to establish a connection, including TCP handshakes/retries.
Time spent completing a SSL handshake.
Time spent the network request.
Time spent waiting for the initial response, also known as time to first bite.
This time captures the latency of a round trip tot the server in addition to the tine spent waiting for the server to deliver the response.
All the above colors we had talke about are related to networking but this relates to your application server.
If its taking long time it means slow application server or slow db query anthing like that.
Time spent  recieving the response.
Lets see how much you get.
It shows every repaint that happens, the resources are comming.
Lets see an example of twitter.com
It is very usefull to identify what loading first your content or your images, are you blocking user for the images and all.
Preserver logs, disable cache, filters and all
